author: Sabine Hossenfelder
description:
Check out my introduction quantum mechanics course on Brilliant! First 30 days are free and 20% off the annual premium subscription when you use our link ➜  https://brilliant.org/sabine. 

A team of biomolecular engineers have come up with a new way to generate electricity from rainfall. Their method involves having rain flow through tiny tubes, and they claim that it can generate up to 100 Watts of electricity per square meter of tubes. Will this revolutionize renewable energy? Let’s find out.

Paper: https://pubs.acs.org/doi/full/10.1021/acscentsci.4c02110

title: New Renewable Unlocked: Researchers Generate Electricity From Rain
